cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 86 (Friday, May 17, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. JACOBS:H.R. 8454.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Section 8 of Article I of the Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:To add counseling in the Transition Assistance Programregarding sexual assault, sexual or gender harassment, andintimate partner violence.[Page H3357]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

cdata.text: This bill requires that pre-separation counseling under the Transition Assistance Program include information concerning health care, including mental health care, furnished by the Department of Veterans Affairs to veterans and members of the Armed Forces who have survived sexual assault, sexual or gender harassment, or intimate partner violence.

bill.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to add to matters covered by counseling in the Transition Assistance Program.

item.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to add to matters covered by counseling in the Transition Assistance Program.
To amend title 10, United States Code, to add to matters covered by counseling in the Transition Assistance Program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
